WORKFLOW.description: Step-by-step process for constructing a restaurant article from raw data

steps.name: Extract Core Facts
steps.action: Pull out: restaurant name, address, phone, hours, price range, star rating, review count, cuisine type, signature dishes, unique features

steps.name: Identify Search Intent
steps.action: Determine what users are searching for: 'Is it worth it?', 'What should I order?', 'How much does it cost?', 'Do I need reservations?' - structure content to answer these immediately

steps.name: Build Essential Info Card
steps.action: Create the main card with rating, pricing, contact, hours, parking - this answers search intent at a glance

steps.name: Craft SEO Title & Meta
steps.action: Write H1 title using format: '[Restaurant Name] Review: Menu, Prices & Worth It?' - meta description summarizes key facts

steps.name: Structure H2 Sections
steps.action: Create subheadings that match user searches: 'What to Order', 'Who It's For', 'Practical Information' - each H2 should answer a specific user question

steps.name: Write Body Content
steps.action: Write as authoritative local guide. State facts directly with confidence. No attribution, no staff names, no first-hand dining claims.

steps.name: Add Pro Tips & Money Hacks
steps.action: Include actionable insider advice using personal voice ('I'd order...', 'Skip the...')

steps.name: Build FAQ Section
steps.action: Answer common questions with direct, factual responses. Use questions people actually search for.

steps.name: Final Review
steps.action: Check for forbidden patterns (staff names, review attribution, first-hand claims). Verify all prices included. Confirm section word limits met.

DATA_INPUT_FORMAT.description: How to process raw restaurant data into article content
expected_inputs: Google Reviews data (rating, count, common themes)

extraction_priority.1_essential: Name, address, phone, hours, rating, review count, price range
extraction_priority.2_content: Signature dishes, unique features, atmosphere description
extraction_priority.3_practical: Parking, reservations, dietary options, best times to visit
extraction_priority.4_balance: Positives AND negatives - both required for credibility

SEARCH_INTENT.description: Understanding and satisfying what users are actually searching for

how_to_satisfy_intent.essential_info_card: Answers pricing, rating, hours, contact immediately - no scrolling required
how_to_satisfy_intent.h2_subheadings: Each H2 should directly answer a user question ('What to Order' answers 'What should I order?')
how_to_satisfy_intent.faq_section: Captures long-tail searches with specific Q&A format
how_to_satisfy_intent.honest_negatives: Users searching 'is it worth it' want balanced truth, not marketing fluff

title_strategy.format: [Restaurant Name] Review: Menu, Prices & Worth It?
title_strategy.why: Captures multiple search intents in one title: review seekers, menu seekers, price checkers, value assessors

SEARCH_MODIFIERS.description: Optimize for how people actually search - not just branded restaurant names

local_modifiers.description: Work these naturally into content, especially opening hook and meta description
examples: where to eat after hiking RMNP

comparison_intent.description: Include 1-2 sentences comparing to similar restaurants in the area
comparison_intent.placement: Who It's For section or What Makes Special section
comparison_intent.format: For [cuisine type], [Restaurant] offers [differentiator] compared to [competitor] which [their differentiator]
examples: For wild game, Grubsteak offers better variety and lower prices than Bird & Jim, which focuses more on upscale presentation
If you want craft beer with your meal, The Hive beats Grubsteak's bar selection hands down
comparison_intent.rule: Be factual, not negative. State what each place does well.

near_me_optimization.placement: Essential info card location field + Practical Information section

signature_dish_keywords.description: Ensure unique menu items appear in searchable locations
placement: Meta description (at least one signature dish)
H2 or content near top of page
signature_dish_keywords.example: Meta for Grubsteak should include 'yak burger' since people search 'yak burger Estes Park'

CONTENT_AND_VOICE._note: MASTER SECTION: All writing rules consolidated here

IDENTITY.description: Write as a knowledgeable local guide who knows the area thoroughly. State information with confidence and authority. You're providing actionable advice, not hedging with citations.
IDENTITY.tone: Confident expert sharing what they know
IDENTITY.NOT: Someone summarizing reviews or citing sources

OPENING_HOOK.description: Start with 2-3 sentences that set the scene before any info blocks. Create desire, establish what problem this restaurant solves, or paint a quick scenario.

problem_solution.description: Address a pain point, offer the fix
problem_solution.example: Tired of the same tourist traps on Elkhorn? The Grubsteak serves yak, elk, and bison - actual adventure on a plate, not another overpriced burger.

scenario.description: Paint a moment the reader can see themselves in
scenario.example: You just finished Bear Lake trail. You're starving, still in hiking boots, and want something better than fast food. The Grubsteak is 10 minutes away with a patio that doesn't care about dress codes.

question.description: Ask what they're wondering, then answer it
question.example: What's the best yak burger in Colorado? Most locals point here. The Grubsteak has served wild game on Elkhorn Avenue for decades.

contrast.description: Set up an expectation, then flip it
contrast.example: Skip the $50 steakhouse. The Grubsteak delivers better wild game at half the price, and you can show up in trail dust.

selection_guide.use_problem_solution: When restaurant solves an obvious frustration (tourist traps, limited options, overpriced competitors)
selection_guide.use_scenario: When location/timing is a key selling point (post-hike, downtown convenience)
selection_guide.use_question: When restaurant owns a niche (best X in town, only place with Y)
selection_guide.use_contrast: When restaurant punches above its price point or defies expectations

OPENING_HOOK.NOT: Jumping straight into ratings, hours, or info cards

allowed_authoritative_guide: The standout dish is the yak burger
Order it medium - lean game meat dries out when overcooked
The back patio is quieter and dog-friendly
Service slows down during peak hours
Skip this if you're in a rush
allowed_first_person_logistical_only: I'd call ahead for weekend dinner
I'd park in the back lot
I'd arrive before 11am to avoid waits

staff_names: ANY specific employee names from reviews - NEVER mention staff by name
false_first_hand_dining_claims: The last time I was there...
FORBIDDEN.CRITICAL_RULE: Transform ALL review data into authoritative statements. Instead of 'reviewers say the ribs are great' write 'the ribs are great'. State facts directly as a knowledgeable guide.

NEGATIVITY_RATIO.good_example: Service slows down during peak hours
NEGATIVITY_RATIO.bad_example: Repeated warnings about slow service throughout the article

menu_and_pricing.rule: NO intro text. Jump straight to menu list.

what_to_order.rule: Dish recommendations with prices, authoritative voice

who_its_for.rule: 1 paragraph 'Best for' + 1 sentence 'Skip if' (70 words max total)

SECTION_WORD_TARGETS.description: Expected word counts per section for consistency

PARAGRAPH_RHYTHM.description: Vary paragraph length to prevent monotony
PARAGRAPH_RHYTHM.pattern: short â†’ medium â†’ short or medium â†’ short â†’ medium
example: The yak burger is the move here. (short - 7 words)
Order it medium - lean game meat dries out fast when overcooked. Add pepper jack and guacamole for the best configuration. (medium - 21 words)
Trust me on the temp. (short - 5 words)
PARAGRAPH_RHYTHM.avoid: Three 50-word paragraphs in a row - feels like a wall of text

PRICING_FORMAT.description: When to use exact prices vs approximate

exact_price.use_when: Price is confirmed from official menu or reliable source

range_format.use_when: Item has size options or add-ons that affect price

per_person_format.use_for: Overall meal cost estimate in info card

MISSING_DATA_HANDLING.description: What to do when information isn't available

hours.if_missing: Write 'Call ahead to confirm hours' instead of guessing
hours.if_partial: List known hours, add 'hours may vary seasonally'

parking.if_missing: Write 'Street parking available in downtown area'

prices.if_missing: Use ~$ with best estimate, or omit item from menu list
prices.if_outdated: Add 'prices may have changed' note at end of menu section

reservations.if_missing: Write 'Call ahead for parties of 6+' as safe default

MISSING_DATA_HANDLING.general_rule: Never invent data. Omit or use safe defaults.

GENERAL_PRINCIPLES: This is a fun read, not a research paper
Flexibility on word limits where flow demands it
Internal links can move to end of article or be cut from 'Who It's For'

1_attribution_to_direct.wrong: Reviews mention the elk burger as a standout dish.
1_attribution_to_direct.right: The elk burger stands out as a signature dish.

2_robotic_to_conversational.wrong: The restaurant offers outdoor patio seating with mountain views.
2_robotic_to_conversational.right: Grab a patio seat if the weather's nice. The mountain views are honestly unreal.

3_formal_to_friendly.wrong: Service quality can vary during peak hours.
3_formal_to_friendly.right: Service slows down during peak hours. Go off-peak if you can.

4_false_experience_to_recommendation.wrong: When I visited, the elk stew was amazing.
4_false_experience_to_recommendation.right: The elk stew is the move here.
